main event: A sighting of an oval-shaped orange-yellow pulsating light was reported in Centerville, Queen Anne's County, MD on March 20, 1952.
interesting points: The object traveled from west to east at a very high speed, disappearing suddenly after about 30 seconds of observation., The object was described as being two to three times the size of an average star., Several witnesses, estimated to be around 6, observed the sighting., The object made a noise similar to that of a motor during its flight., A hand-drawn diagram of the object's trajectory was included in the report.
